page.title: 07HISTORY IN BURSCOUGH 1
page.content: Burscough's main feature is probably the Leeds and Liverpool Canal.It took 46yrs, to dig.Work began in 1770 and finished in 1846.It is 127.25 miles long.Bargees' children were given schooling by Mr. Henrickson during the early 1900's.In the summer of 1901 the Canal dried up because of the heat and the Bargemen were out of work for 3mths Ainscoughs Mill was built in 1885 and stands on the canal bank so grain could be unloaded from, and the miiled flour loaded onto, barges.The Mill and Canal brought work to the village and the population has grown from 2752(in 1901) to the present 8391. The oldest building is probably the cottage on the corner of Warpers Moss Lane and School Lane (1794). Other old properties include some in Orrell Lane (1879),Park Grove Residential Home,once 2 houses and the Library building.
